values:
Sitting on her back steps now. Its a beautiful sunny day. There is a chill in the air that makes the sun precious. I'm too used to the sun being something to avoid too much of. To desire it now is a new experience. I left the door open while taking the garbage out. Her 18yr old indoor cat trepidaciously looked outside a world he's never known. I decided to sit with him. 18 years is old for a cat. 

This house would be nice if not for all her odd rules and hang ups. I suppose everyone feels that way about everyone and everything. She fears loosing things. She fears people taking away what is hers. She fears not having enough. She balances her fear of mess and filth with her fear of things being taken from her by hiring me.

I balance my fear of not having money, of being in debt, of doing the same thing in the same place and never finding myself with my fear of... everything.

It is nice to sit here. I wish she wouldn't lock the doors all the time and demand the same of me. I wish she wouldn't set the house alarm all the time. To run through a door on a whim, to sit on porch step on a sunny day without premeditation. How wonderful. In this way i miss the trailer.

I've never been one to drop the "L" bomb too fast.  It fact, i find that word sticks in my throat.  I mean i've said "I love you" before, but it seems like people drop that line so quick these days.  Its like they long for love and then they call it like shotgun before it slips away in the night.  I think i'm just too skeptical for all that.  On the back of the head rest on the seat of the greyhound in front of me, i stared at "I heart Brittney 4 life" all the way until Dallas.  There was something desperate about it.  Scrawled in permanent marker, i seriously doubted that this statement still held any truth, only serving as a relic.

I think the problem is when people decide on love as a solution, or anything for that matter, as a solution.

Today my stupid cat freaked out for no reason.  She jumped up onto the bar and then wormed her way behind my glass vase that i bought at tj maxx last year because i thought it was really pretty and i don't usually like things like that but this time i did... when i came closer to keep the vase from falling, she freaked out and ran out the door.  The vase couldn't be more broken.  It spun around three times before it fell.  I felt like god looking down on the misery of the world, unable to stop it or unwilling.  Everything i dare to love turns back into the sands of its origin.  Maybe i just need to hurry up and love this fact instead of feeling abandoned by it.
